The film, which also featured Ishaan Khatter, earned over ₹110 crore at the worldwide box office.

175.title: Elon Musk's answer to Twitter lawsuit to be made public by Friday
175.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's response to Twitter's lawsuit over his abandoned $44 billion buyout deal will be made public latest by Friday evening, a judge said. Musk's attorneys wanted to file the public version of their response on Wednesday, however, Twitter attorneys needed more time. "Few cases attract as much public interest as this one," the Twitter attorney wrote.

176.title: Happy that I could 'turn my coat': Supriyo on trolls calling him 'turncoat'
176.article_body: TMC's Babul Supriyo, who got inducted into Mamata Banerjee's cabinet on Wednesday, responded to trolls who called him a "turncoat" and said, "I am extremely happy I could show courage to 'Turn my Coat' on a party who unfairly tried to make me a 'Scape Goat'." "Half of your state governments are with 'poached' MLA's from other parties," he added.

177.title: Traffic to be hit on some routes of Mumbai due to VVIP visit
177.article_body: Traffic movement is expected to be slow on Eastern Freeway and Western Expressway on Thursday due to scheduled VVIP visit, the Mumbai Traffic Police said. The traffic will be slow from 9 am to 2 pm between NCPA to Vashi on Eastern Freeway and between 3 pm to 8 pm between NCPA to Dindoshi on Western Expressway, the police said.

178.title: Delhi reports India's 1st monkeypox case in a woman, city's count reaches 4
178.article_body: A Nigerian woman, living in Delhi for over a month, on Wednesday tested positive for monkeypox. This is the first confirmed monkeypox case in a woman in India. The number of confirmed monkeypox cases in Delhi has reached four and India's total tally has reached nine. Notably, the woman had no history of international travel in the last 21 days.

179.title: US Senate approves Sweden & Finland's bid to join NATO amid Ukraine war
179.article_body: US Senate has ratified the entry of Sweden and Finland into NATO amid Russia's war in Ukraine. Senate voted 95 to 1 in favour of the two countries' accession. "This historic vote sends an important signal of...sustained, bipartisan US commitment to NATO, and to ensuring our alliance is prepared to meet...challenges of today and tomorrow," US President Joe Biden said.

180.title: More special than gold: Anurag Thakur on Tejaswin's historic bronze
180.article_body: Reacting to Indian high jumper Tejaswin Shankar scripting history by becoming the first-ever Indian to win a medal in high jump at CWG, Sports Minister Anurag Thakur tweeted, "This bronze is more special than a gold!!" Tejaswin won a bronze medal with a best jump of 2.22 metres. He helped India win its first medal in athletics at CWG 2022.

181.title: 'Grotesque greed': UN chief criticises oil and gas companies
181.article_body: United Nations (UN) chief Antonio Guterres on Wednesday criticised the oil and gas companies for making record profits from the energy crisis "on the backs of the poorest people and communities and at a massive cost to the climate". Guterres further said that their "grotesque greed" was destroying "our only...home". He also urged all governments to tax these profits.

182.title: China begins its largest-ever military exercises around Taiwan
182.article_body: China has begun its largest-ever military exercises around Taiwan. This comes after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan despite China's warnings of consequences over it. Earlier, local news outlets reported that the Taiwanese Ministry of National Defense has begun to "immediately prepare for war" and has put the military on high alert.

183.title: My acting in 'A Thursday' left my house help terrified: Yami Gautam
183.article_body: Yami Gautam revealed that her house help was 'terrified' after watching her performance in 'A Thursday'. The woman reportedly told the actress that she broke a glass and hoped that she wouldn't treat her like the film. Yami added that she took it as a compliment and was happy that she managed to create such an impact through her performance.

184.title: India to have US-like roads by 2024: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari
184.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said government will construct 26 green express highways by 2024 and bring down travel time between key cities across India. "By 2024, I guarantee...roads in India will be like those in US," he added. Furthermore, he said, once highways are completed, travel time from Delhi to Dehradun, Haridwar and Jaipur will be reduced to two hours.

185.title: Winter COVID wave may have peaked early: Australian Health Minister
185.article_body: Australian Health Minister Mark Butler said on Thursday that the country may have reached the peak of the latest wave of COVID-19 outbreak earlier than expected. Australia witnessed winter outbreak due to the new Omicron sub-variant BA.4/5, putting strain on hospitals and retirement homes. However, hospitals have reported a steady fall in number of admissions over the past week.

186.title: Sensex jumps 334.22 points, Nifty above 17,479 in opening trade
186.article_body: Benchmark indices opened on a positive note on Thursday with Sensex and Nifty surging 334.22 points and 91.60 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 58,684.75 points and Nifty at 17,479.80. Hindalco Industries, Infosys, UltraTech Cement and IndusInd Bank were among the major Nifty gainers, while Tata Consumer Products, Britannia Industries, SBI Life Insurance, ONGC and Divis Labs slipped.

187.title: 7-yr-old boy makes Zomato deliveries on cycle till 11pm after father's accident
187.article_body: A Twitter user shared a video, showing a seven-year-old boy delivering orders for Zomato after his father, a Zomato delivery agent, met with an accident. The boy said that he goes to school in the morning and delivers orders from 6-11pm on a cycle. "Kindly share his father's details with us via a private message," Zomato replied on the post.

188.title: A year ago, I realised I didn't spend much time with Ira & Junaid: Aamir
188.article_body: Aamir Khan, on the show 'Koffee With Karan 7', said he went through "a lot of introspection" last year. "I felt I didn't nurture my relationships like my work. I realised...I've not spent so much time with Ira...Junaid since they were children," he stated. Aamir added he's a changed person now and connects more with his family and his children.

189.title: India reports 19,893 new COVID-19 cases, list of states with most active cases released
189.article_body: India has reported 19,893 COVID-19 cases and 53 deaths in the last 24 hours including 15 reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's active COVID-19 cases stood at 1,36,478, while the death toll reached 5,26,530. Kerala has the maximum active cases in the country at 12,715, followed by Maharashtra with 12,321 active cases and Tamil Nadu with 11,392 active cases.

190.title: Gurugram man posed as pilot on Instagram, cheated over 30 women
190.article_body: Gurugram Police arrested a man from Sector 43 area for allegedly duping over 30 women after befriending them on Instagram by posing as a pilot, officials said. The matter came to light after a woman filed a complaint that accused Hemant Sharma fraudulently transferred over ₹1 lakh from her account. He especially used to befriend airline crew members, police said.

191.title: ASEAN warns of open conflicts due to volatility over Taiwan
191.article_body: The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) issued a warning on Thursday that an increased international and regional volatility could result in "miscalculation, serious confrontation, open conflicts and unpredictable consequences" among powers. The statement came from foreign ministers when the Southeast Asian regional bloc's chair Cambodia called on all parties to de-escalate on Taiwan.

192.title: Party 'under siege': Cong after police deployed outside party headquarters
192.article_body: After ED sealed the Congress-owned National Herald office and police were deployed outside Congress headquarters, party's General Secretary Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said Congress is "under siege". Another Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi said, "You're treating this institution, this party, these leaders as terrorists. It's the worst form of petty politics and on the contrary, you blame us."

193.title: Chrissy Teigen announces pregnancy 2 years after miscarriage; shares pics
193.article_body: Chrissy Teigen and her husband John Legend are expecting another child nearly two years after the couple suffered a pregnancy loss. Teigen made the announcement on Wednesday while sharing two photos of her baby bump on Instagram. "We have another on the way," wrote the 36-year-old model, who shares two children — Luna and Miles — with Legend.

194.title: Bengaluru records highest rainfall in August in last 5 yrs: IMD
194.article_body: Bengaluru recorded 63.3 mm of rainfall till Wednesday, which is the highest in last five years in the month of August, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. The previous highest rainfall for August was recorded at 128.7 mm in 2017. Several areas in Bengaluru including Horamavu, Sarjapur, Bellandur and Nandini Layout reported waterlogging following heavy rainfall on Monday and Tuesday.

195.title: 2 workers dead, 1 injured after gas leakage at factory in WB's North 24 Parganas
195.article_body: At least two workers died and one was hospitalised in a gas leak incident at an electro steel factory on Wednesday in North 24 Parganas' Khardah in West Bengal, police said. Carbon monoxide gas leaked from the factory, as per initial reports. The injured person was hospitalised and is in critical condition, police added. A case has been registered.

196.title: Mangroves along Palm Beach Road in Mumbai destroyed, claim environmentalists
196.article_body: More than 10 hectares of mangroves along Palm Beach Road in Navi Mumbai is in need of preservation as there are repeated instances to destroy these natural habitats, claimed the city environmentalists. A PIL is filed in court highlighting the matter which states that the mangroves along 4 km are destroyed as the area is not transferred to Forest Department.

197.title: Amrita Singh visited me at K3G trials, said 'Sara wants a picture with you': Kareena
197.article_body: Kareena Kapoor revealed her husband and actor Saif Ali Khan's ex-wife Amrita Singh had visited her while she was at the trials of 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham'. "I remember at the K3G trials, Sara Ali Khan was hiding behind her mother," she stated. "Amrita was...like 'Sara...wants a picture because she's...a big fan. She had loved Poo in K3G'," Kareena added.

198.title: Police bust fake firm offering loans of up to ₹100 cr in Pune, 3 held
198.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Police busted a fake firm offering loans of up to ₹100 crore and cheating several persons in Maharashtra, and arrested three persons in connection with the case. This comes after a man, a Kothrud resident, claimed he was offered a loan of ₹1 crore within 45 days of payment of a security deposit of ₹5 lakh in cash.

199.title: ₹85 lakh cash found at MP clerk's home during search, he drinks bathroom cleaner
199.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Police's Economic Offences Wing recovered over ₹85 lakh cash from the home of a government clerk attached to the state Medical Education Department in Bhopal. The clerk, Hero Keswani, reportedly consumed bathroom cleaner when the EOW team reached his house and was rushed to a hospital. Documents pertaining to several properties worth crores of rupees were also found.

200.title: 1,200-yr-old Hindu temple in Pakistan to be restored after eviction of illegal occupants
200.article_body: A 1,200-year-old Hindu temple in Pakistan's Lahore will be restored after illegal occupants were evicted from it following a lengthy court battle, a federal body said. The Evacuee Trust Property Board (ETPB) last month retrieved the possession of the Valmiki Mandir. The property was possessed by a Christian family, which claims to have converted to Hinduism.

201.title: Bengaluru reports 1,584 fresh cases of COVID-19, 1 death
201.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,584 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Wednesday, according to data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief Tushar Giri Nath. The city also reported one death due to COVID-19 on Wednesday. Moreover, with 8,464 active cases, the test positivity rate in the city for the last seven days now stands at 7.94%, BBMP data showed.

202.title: BJP wants to put money into pockets of big businessmen: Rahul Gandhi
202.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said BJP wants that nothing in India should be made by small and medium businesses. "They want everything made by two to three of their favourite big businessmen. Their entire idea is to take money out of people's pockets and put it into big businessmen's pockets," he added while addressing the media in Karnataka.

203.title: Don't fly kites near electric cables: BSES advisory for Independence Day
203.article_body: Ahead of Independence Day, BSES, a company which supplies power in Delhi, issued an advisory, asking people not to fly kites near electrical installations or cables as it could pose risk to life. The BSES also asked people to avoid using metal or metal-coated manjha. These two simple mantras will ensure safe Independence Day celebrations, a BSES official said.

204.title: DDA can't evict encroachers with bulldozer at doorstep without notice: HC
204.article_body: Delhi Development Authority (DDA) cannot evict encroachers with a bulldozer at their doorstep early morning or late evening without any notice, Delhi High Court said. "DDA has to act in consultation with Delhi Urban Shelter Improvement Board before embarking upon any such venture," it added. "A reasonable period has to be given...temporary location has to be provided," HC ruled.

205.title: Was never offered the film: Kareena on reports of demanding ₹12 cr to play Sita
205.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has refuted the reports that had claimed she demanded ₹12 crore to play the role of Sita in the epic 'Ramayana'. "I was never offered that film so I don't know why I was put into that category," she stated. The actress called these "made-up stories" and added she doesn't know where the reports emerged from.

206.title: UK Parliament closes its TikTok account over China concerns
206.article_body: The UK Parliament has closed down its TikTok account after MPs raised concerns about the risk of data being passed to the Chinese government. "The account was a pilot initiative while we tested the platform as a way of reaching younger audiences with relevant content about Parliament," a spokesperson said. TikTok is owned by Chinese company ByteDance.

207.title: 7 dead people receive wages under MGNREGA for a year; 9 booked in Nuh
207.article_body: Haryana's Nuh Police have booked nine people for allegedly issuing job cards under the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA). The cards were fraudulently issued to 87 people, including seven men who died between 2011 and 2017. Their bank accounts received wages under MGNREGA for one year, causing a loss of ₹21 lakh to state exchequer, police said.

208.title: Tejaswin Shankar wins bronze, India's first medal in high jump in CWG history
208.article_body: Indian high jumper Tejaswin Shankar created history by becoming the first-ever Indian to win a medal in high jump in the history of Commonwealth Games (CWG). The 23-year-old bagged bronze medal with a best jump of 2.22 metres in men's high jump at CWG 2022. It is India's first athletics medal at the ongoing Games.

209.title: Mumbai chana vendor cheated by frauds posing as army officers
209.article_body: A 45-year-old vendor who sells chana outside the Breach Candy Hospital at Cumballa Hill was cheated of ₹16,400 by frauds posing as army officers. The accused called the victim pretending to be an officer of the Indian Army and ordered chana. However, he took money from the vendor in the guise of getting him a refund but escaped with ₹16,400.

210.title: 8-yr-old dies of suspected pesticide poisoning in B'luru
210.article_body: An eight-year-old girl died of suspected pesticide poisoning in Bengaluru's Vasanth Nagar on Tuesday, while her parents are still being treated at a private hospital. They had been advised to stay away from their rented accommodation till the clean-up for pest control was over. The family returned early and inhaled toxic fumes and drank coffee made of contaminated water.

211.title: Gurdeep Singh lifts 390 kg to win bronze, India's 10th weightlifting medal at CWG 2022
211.article_body: India's 26-year-old weightlifter Gurdeep Singh bagged a bronze medal in the men's 109+ kg final after lifting a total of 390 kg. He lifted 167 kg in the snatch event and 223 kg in the clean and jerk event. India have now won 10 medals in weightlifting at CWG 2022, including four bronze, three silver and three gold medals.

212.title: Such issues shouldn't be politicised: RSS responds to critics
212.article_body: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) has responded to critics over why their social media does not have a tricolour photo as their profile picture, saying that such things should not be politicised. RSS Akhil Bharatiya Prachar Pramukh Sunil Ambekar said that the RSS has already extended its support to 'Har Ghar Tiranga' and 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' programmes.

213.title: 23-year-old Tulika Maan wins silver medal at CWG 2022, takes India's tally to 16 medals
213.article_body: Judoka Tulika Maan on Wednesday bagged a silver medal in judo at CWG 2022, taking India's medal tally at the Games to 16. The 23-year-old lost to Sarah Adlington of Scotland in the women's +78 kg category final. India have won three medals in judo at CWG 2022 so far, including one bronze and two silver medals.

214.title: Congress united to defeat BJP in Karnataka: Rahul Gandhi
214.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that the party was united to defeat BJP in the Karnataka state assembly elections after the state party chief DK Shivakumar hugged Siddaramaiah in a public show of unity. Both the leaders are in the front-running for the Chief Minister's post if Congress wins the elections. Gandhi praised the tremendous work done by Shivakumar.

215.title: We are not afraid: Congress after ED seals National Herald office
215.article_body: After ED sealed Congress-owned National Herald office and police were deployed outside Congress headquarters, the party's General Secretary Jairam Ramesh said, "This is politics of vengeance [and] intimidation." "Those who...spread the atmosphere of fear are afraid. We are not afraid," he added. He added that Delhi Police are trying to suppress Congress from holding a protest against inflation.

216.title: Sri Lankan Prez proposes 25-year roadmap for crisis-hit nation
216.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Wednesday said his government is preparing a 25-year national policy to reduce public debt and make the nation competitive in the export market. Sri Lanka is experiencing one of its worst economic crises, with it suspending repayment of foreign loans in April this year. In total, Sri Lanka owes $51 billion in foreign debt.

217.title: 17 killed, 4 wounded as microbus hits truck in south Egypt
217.article_body: At least 17 people were killed and four people were injured when a microbus hit a truck in southern Egypt's Sohag province, 390 km from capital Cairo, officials said on Wednesday. Deadly accidents take thousands of lives in Egypt each year. The accidents happen mostly because of overspeeding, poor roads or lack of traffic law enforcement.

218.title: Hyderabad-based finance operations startup Bluecopa raises $2.3 mn
218.article_body: Finance operations startup, Bluecopa, raised $2.3 million in a seed funding round. The round was led by Blume Ventures and saw participation from Titan Capital, T-Fund, Speciale Invest, Bharat Founders Fund, T2D3, Amplify and Force Ventures. The Hyderabad-based firm, founded by Raghavendra Reddy, Satyaprakash Buddhavarapu and Nilotpal Chanda, helps companies get a real-time view of their business.

219.title: Retired B'luru CCB inspector gets 4-yr jail in illegal assets case
219.article_body: A former police inspector from the Bengaluru City Crime Branch (CCB), Sami-ur-Rahman, was sentenced to four years of rigorous imprisonment by a special court in a disproportionate assets case. He was raided in March 2006 and was found to have disproportionate assets worth ₹79.79 lakh. The court imposed a fine of ₹50 lakh on Rahman and ₹50,000 on his wife.

220.title: Meta exploring its first-ever sale of corporate bonds: Reports
220.article_body: Meta Platforms has reportedly asked banks to look into demand for a potential corporate bond sale, what would be the firm's first bond sale. The company has reportedly asked Morgan Stanley, JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America and Barclays to arrange calls with potential investors. Meta is one of 18 companies among S&P 500 that has no long-term or short-term debt.

221.title: Congress calls meeting of MPs to discuss future strategy of party
221.article_body: Congress has called a meeting of its Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha MPs at Congress Parliamentary Party office on Thursday to discuss the future strategy of the party. This comes after Enforcement Directorate sealed Congress-owned National Herald office. Moreover, police officers were deployed outside Congress headquarters and Sonia Gandhi's residence to prevent any potential protest against ED's move.

222.title: Partha not cooperating, Arpita comparatively forthcoming: ED to court
222.article_body: Additional Solicitor General of India SV Raju claimed before the court that Partha Chatterjee has not been cooperating in the investigation, while Arpita Mukherjee has been comparatively cooperative. ED sought four days' custody of former Education Minister Partha Chatterjee in the SSC scam case before a special court in Kolkata on Wednesday.

223.title: Gujarat's Surat reports 1st death from swine flu this year
223.article_body: Surat in Gujarat reported its first death due to swine flu this year. The victim has been identified as a 49-year-old woman, from the Nana Varachha area, who was admitted to a private hospital a few days ago. So far this year, 32 swine flu patients have been hospitalised in the city, Surat Municipal Corporation's Health Department said.

224.title: 15-yr-old footballer raped by 2 teenage boys in Ranchi, accused held
224.article_body: Police on Wednesday said that a 15-year-old footballer was allegedly raped by two teenage boys in Jharkhand's Ranchi. The incident took place when the girl was returning home after playing a football match in Odisha on Monday, the police added. She registered a complaint on Tuesday, following which the two boys, around 17 years old, were arrested, police said.

225.title: Saurav Ghosal becomes 1st Indian squash player to win a CWG singles medal, bags bronze
225.article_body: Saurav Ghosal on Wednesday created history by becoming the first-ever Indian to win a singles medal in squash in the history of CWG. The 35-year-old defeated England's James Willstrop to finish third in the men's singles event at CWG 2022. Notably, Ghosal had won silver medal in mixed doubles event at CWG 2018 in Gold Coast.

226.title: Kolkata school to build its own nano-satellite
226.article_body: A Kolkata-based private school will build its own nano-satellite to educate its students in space technology. South Point High School has named the satellite 'PriyamvadaSat' and signed an agreement with Indian Technology Congress Association for its design, development, testing, integration and launch. ISRO will send the satellite into Low Earth Orbit from Sriharikota.

227.title: US, Indonesia conduct military drills amid Chinese threat
227.article_body: The US and Indonesia began their annual joint military exercises on Wednesday amid growing maritime concerns posed by China in the Indo-Pacific. For the first time, soldiers from Australia, Japan and Singapore joined the combat drills. "It's a symbol of the US-Indonesia bond and the growing relationship between land forces in this consequential region," the US said in a statement.

228.title: 2 killed, 2 injured in a bus-car collision in Rajasthan's Barmer
228.article_body: At least two people were killed and two others were injured after a bus collided with a car in Rajasthan's Barmer on Wednesday, police said. The deceased were identified as 44-year-old Jeer Bhai, the car driver, and 42-year-old Varsha. The occupants of the car hailed from Gujarat and were on their way to visit Ramdevra, the SHO said.

229.title: 25-year-old man falls off Mumbai local train; dies
229.article_body: A 25-year-old man died after falling off a fast local train between Dombivli and Diva stations in Mumbai on Wednesday, the Government Railway Police (GRP) said. As per the preliminary investigation, the man who was travelling on the CSTM-bound suburban train was probably standing on its footboard when his head hit a pole along the railway track, and he fell.

230.title: Kerala man going from Kanyakumari to Kashmir on skateboard dies in Haryana
230.article_body: Anas Hajas, a 31-year-old resident of Kerala who was travelling from Kanyakumari to Kashmir on a skateboard, lost his life after a speeding truck hit him in Haryana's Panchkula on Tuesday. Hajas had started his 3,511-km-long journey on May 29 to create awareness among people about skating. After completing this trip, he was planning trips to Nepal, Bhutan and Cambodia.

231.title: 18 TRS MLAs, 5 Congress MLAs to join BJP: Telangana BJP leader
231.article_body: Telangana BJP leader Natcharaju Venkata Subhash claimed Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) has decided that around 15-18 of its MLAs will join BJP. "TRS MLAs are unable to go to their...constituencies because of the false promises [made by CM Chandrashekar Rao]," he added. Further, he said five Congress MLAs have consented to join BJP. This comes ahead of Telangana Assembly elections.

232.title: India announce playing XI for their must-win match against Barbados at CWG 2022
232.article_body: Barbados captain Hayley Matthews won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in their last women's T20I cricket group match at CWG 2022. The winner of the match between India and Barbados will advance to the semi-finals along with Australia from Group A. India have included Taniyaa Bhatia and Pooja Vastrakar in their playing XI.

233.title: Traveller fined ₹1.4 lakh after food found in luggage at Aus airport
233.article_body: A traveller was fined AUD 2,664 (₹1.4 lakh) by airport authorities in Australia's Darwin after undeclared food was detected in their luggage by a security dog. The person, who had arrived from Indonesia's Bali, was reportedly carrying sandwiches from McDonald's. The traveller was fined under Australia's new biosecurity rules after a Foot and Mouth disease outbreak was reported in Indonesia.

234.title: Srinagar received record rainfall this June and July: Report
234.article_body: Srinagar received the highest rainfall in 122 years for the months of June and July in this year, according to a private weather report on Wednesday. The observatory at Ram Munshi Bagh in the Valley recorded total rainfall of 230.0 mm for the two months, which is 107% above average. The average rain for this period is 110.9 mm.

235.title: UP Police arrest 11 for stealing copper wires from railway dept
235.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Police arrested 11 people who allegedly stole copper wires from the Mirzapur district's railway department. Police raided a semi-constructed house and arrested 10 people and recovered 107 kg copper wires, ₹50,740, five illegal guns and an SUV, among other things. The police said that the accused persons were stealing and selling the copper wires.

236.title: Delhi sees over 2,000 new COVID-19 cases & 5 deaths; positivity rate at 11.64%
236.article_body: Delhi reported 2,073 new COVID-19 cases and five deaths on Wednesday, while the positivity rate stood at 11.64%. This is the highest single-day rise in cases in over a month and third day in a row that the positivity rate has crossed the 10% mark. On Tuesday, Delhi saw 1,506 fresh COVID-19 cases and the positivity rate stood at 10.63%.

237.title: New Moonlighting policy allows Swiggy employees to take second job
237.article_body: Food delivery platform Swiggy announced an industry-first Moonlighting policy which allows employees to work on other projects after work hours for pro-bono or economic consideration, based on internal approvals. A company release said that this was another step to building a "world-class 'people-first' organisation". The policy allows employees to work second jobs, under certain conditions.

238.title: BharatPe appoints ex-head of SBI Card Nalin Negi as CFO
238.article_body: Fintech unicorn BharatPe has appointed the former head of SBI Card, Nalin Negi, as its Chief Financial Officer as the company prepares for its Initial Public Offering (IPO). In a statement, BharatPe said that Negi will be working towards making the company EBITDA positive by March 2023. Negi will be reporting to Suhail Sameer, the company's Chief Executive Officer (CEO).

239.title: Assam to remit sentences of 18 prisoners by Independence Day
239.article_body: To commemorate the 75th year of independence, Assam government has decided to remit the sentences of 18 prisoners under certain categories, as per a notification. The 18 prisoners will be released by Independence Day. All state governments were directed by the Ministry of Home Affairs to give special remission to certain categories of prisoners and release them.

240.title: Plea seeking 'jalabhishek' of Lord Krishna at Mathura mosque rejected
240.article_body: A district court in Mathura, Uttar Pradesh, on Wednesday rejected a revised application seeking permission to perform the 'jalabhishek' of Lord Krishna on the premises of Shahi Idgah Masjid. The petition had been filed by Dinesh Sharma, national treasurer of Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha. He claimed the birthplace of Lord Krishna exists inside the premises of the mosque in Mathura.

241.title: ICC releases all-time T20I batting rankings as Suryakumar enters top 20
241.article_body: The ICC has shared the latest all-time T20I batting rankings, with India's Suryakumar Yadav entering the top 20. Suryakumar is ranked 17th with 816 rating points. Virat Kohli (897 rating points) and KL Rahul (854) are the other two Indians to feature in the top 20. The all-time rankings are led by Dawid Malan, with 915 rating points.

242.title: 15 men enter woman's house and kidnap her in Tamil Nadu, CCTV footage surfaces
242.article_body: A woman was kidnapped by her stalker and 14 of his associates at her house in Tamil Nadu's Mayiladuthurai on Tuesday. Based on a tipoff, the police immediately formed a special team, zeroed down on the accused and rescued the woman. Reports suggested that the woman was kidnapped after she refused to accept the proposal of the prime accused.

243.title: Clerk consumes floor cleaner during raid at his house in Bhopal
243.article_body: An Upper Divisional Clerk (UDC) working with Madhya Pradesh's Medical Education Department reportedly consumed floor cleaner during an Economic Offence Wing (EOW) raid at his house in Bhopal on Wednesday. The EOW had reached his home to conduct searches in connection to a complaint of disproportionate assets. The 54-year-old was rushed to a hospital and is said to be stable.

244.title: Sri Lanka SC extends foreign travel ban on ex-PM Mahinda till Aug 11
244.article_body: Sri Lankan Supreme Court on Wednesday extended the overseas travel ban on ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa and ex-Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa till August 11 amid the country's economic crisis. Notably, ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who is currently in Singapore, will now be able to stay there till August 11 as he was reportedly granted a 14-day extension on his short-term visa pass.

245.title: Once cycled 100 km to get firm listed on London Stock Exchange: Vedanta chief
245.article_body: Vedanta Resources Chairman Anil Agarwal said he once had to cycle 100 km to get his company listed on London Stock Exchange. Agarwal said then JP Morgan Vice Chairman Ian Hannam had invited him to cycle to Oxford to challenge him, which was about 100 km away. "I immediately said yes...After a few hours, I could barely continue," he added.

246.title: Respond to attacks but maintain decency: Uddhav to Sena spokespersons
246.article_body: Shiv Sena spokesperson Arvind Sawant said party chief Uddhav Thackeray met with Shiv Sena spokespersons on Wednesday to discuss the crisis within the party. Sawant said Thackeray asked the spokespersons to respond to attacks but maintain decency of language. Another party spokesperson Sachin Ahir said Thackeray guided them on effective ways to accomplish the tasks they were assigned.

247.title: MP villagers beat up Maha men on cattle smuggling suspicion; 1 dead, 2 injured
247.article_body: Villagers in Madhya Pradesh's Narmadapuram allegedly beat up three men from Maharashtra's Amravati on suspicion of cattle smuggling, police said. While one man died, two others were injured after the villagers stopped their truck carrying 28 cattle. "We're trying to figure out if they just provided the truck or were...[taking] the bovines for their own business," said SP Gurkaran Singh.

248.title: Delhi Police stopped us from conducting raid in J'khand MLAs case: CID
248.article_body: West Bengal CID alleged that police officers acting on the direction of South West Delhi's DCP stopped its team from conducting a raid in Chanakyapuri in connection with the Jharkhand MLAs cash seizure case. "We weren't allowed to search [businessman Sidharth Majumdar's residence] because the investigating officer...in whose name the [search warrant was] issued wasn't present," a CID officer said.

249.title: TV actor Parul Gulati cheated of ₹2.2 lakh by assistant in Mumbai
249.article_body: TV and Punjabi film actor Parul Gulati, who owns a hair wig manufacturing company, was reportedly cheated of ₹2.2 lakh over the past month by her assistant in Mumbai. Parul alleged that the accused, Komal Parmar, contacted her clients, who used to visit her office for wig trials, without her knowledge and sold them the products at cheaper rates.

250.title: UP govt will provide at least 1 job per family: CM Yogi Adityanath
250.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said on Wednesday that the state government will provide at least one job to every family in an effort to boost employment. He stated that a skill mapping exercise to gather data on families where no member is employed will be initiated soon. "As per requirement, people will be trained and associated with employment," he added.

251.title: Jawan martyred after boulder falls on him in Uttarakhand
251.article_body: An Army jawan was martyred and another was injured after a boulder fell on them in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district near the China border. Soldier Sukhjinder Singh fell into a deep gorge from the impact of the boulder where he died. The jawans were posted at the Army unit in Harshil valley and were walking from Nelang when the incident occurred.

252.title: Indo-Canadian politician rescues man from bull at event, gets praise
252.article_body: An Indo-Canadian politician from Alberta has garnered praise for tackling a bull and rescuing a man from being trampled by the animal at a rodeo event in Calgary. Leela Aheer had jumped over the barrier to push the animal away from the man on the ground. Aheer, who is also Alberta's MLA, said that she acted upon her maternal instincts.

253.title: 42 inmates test positive for COVID-19 in Haridwar jail
253.article_body: At least 42 prisoners in Uttarakhand's Haridwar jail have tested positive for COVID-19, officials said on Wednesday. "On World Hepatitis Day along with Hepatitis B, RT-PCR test of prisoners was conducted during a medical camp," Superintendent of Haridwar prison Manoj Kumar Arya said. All prisoners who tested positive are asymptomatic, Manoj Kumar Arya added.

254.title: Seminary teacher arrested for raping 10 minor students in Pakistan
254.article_body: A seminary teacher was arrested in Pakistan's Punjab province on Wednesday for allegedly raping 10 minor male students, officials said. Qari Bashir confessed to committing the crimes in the last two months in Sadiqabad Rahim Yar Khan and was now in police custody, officials said. Five of the survivors were sent to hospital for medical examination.

255.title: CM Mamata is kingpin, she should quit: Suvendu Adhikari on SSC scam
255.article_body: Leading a protest against SSC scam in Kolkata, West Bengal BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari said Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee is the kingpin in the scam and demanded her resignation. "It is the party's money, CM Banerjee's money. Partha Chatterjee was only a custodian," Adhikari said. "Her (Mamata Banerjee's) whole racket should be taken into custody," he added.

256.title: 4,690 arrested under UAPA from 2018-2020, only 149 convicted: Govt
256.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai on Wednesday said 4,690 people were arrested under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) between 2018 and 2020, but only 149 were convicted in three years. The highest number of people arrested under UAPA between 2018 and 2020 was in Uttar Pradesh, which was 1,338, Rai said, adding 943 were arrested in Manipur.

257.title: 38-yr-old woman smothered to death by in-laws in J&K's Bemina, 5 held
257.article_body: A 38-year-old woman, Tasleema Bani, was allegedly smothered to death by her in-laws in Jammu and Kashmir's Bemina area, after which five members of the family were arrested, a police spokesperson said on Wednesday. The woman was taken to a hospital, where she was declared dead. The postmortem report stated that asphyxiation was the cause of the woman's death.

258.title: India announce schedule for their home series against Australia and South Africa
258.article_body: The BCCI on Wednesday announced the schedule for India's upcoming series against Australia and South Africa at home. India will play three T20Is against Australia from September 20 to 25. India-South Africa T20I series will begin on September 28 and end on October 4. The T20I series will be followed by a three-match ODI series from October 6 to 11.

259.title: India thrash Canada 8-0 in men's hockey, jump to top of their group at CWG 2022
259.article_body: India defeated Canada 8-0 in their second-last Pool B match in men's hockey at CWG 2022. With the win, India jumped to the top of Pool B with 7 points and a goal difference of 19. Harmanpreet Singh and Akashdeep Singh scored two goals each against Canada. India will next face Wales on Thursday.

260.title: Traffic diversions in Hyderabad over inauguration of new police HQ
260.article_body: Hyderabad Police announced a series of traffic diversions as the Telangana Chief Minister will be inaugurating the Technology Fusion Centre on August 4. The new police headquarters is located in Banjara Hills and the Hyderabad Traffic Police asked motorists to avoid Road No 12 between 11 am and 5 pm. Over ₹600 crore was spent on building the centre.

261.title: Indigo narrows Q1 net loss to ₹1,064 crore, revenue up 328%
261.article_body: Indigo's parent company, Interglobe Aviation said that its net loss narrowed to ₹1,064.3 crore for the quarter ended June as against ₹3,174.2 crore in the year-ago period. Its revenue from operations rose 328%. “Our revenue performance this quarter was impressive...However, cost pressures on fuel and foreign exchange prevented us from translating...into net profitability," CEO Ronojoy Dutta said.

262.title: 4 dead, 2 critical after gas leakage at a factory in Haryana
262.article_body: At least four people died and two were injured after gas leakage at a factory in Haryana's Bahadurgarh industrial area on Wednesday. The injured persons were admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU) at a hospital. "Labourers had gone down a five-foot-deep tank to clean it," a senior officer said.

263.title: Ex-German Chancellor meets Putin, discusses Ukraine war
263.article_body: Germany's former Chancellor Gerhard Schröder has met Russian President Vladimir Putin, and discussed the Russia-Ukraine war. Schröder said last month's deal to provide a safe route in the Black Sea to move Ukrainian grain stocks could be the first step towards a ceasefire in the Russia-Ukraine war. However, neither of the countries have indicated this as attacks have continued.

264.title: Water vapour sent into stratosphere by Tonga eruption could heat up Earth
264.article_body: The underwater eruption of Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volcano in January released a record amount of water into the Earth's atmosphere, NASA scientists said. The eruption expelled 146 teragrams of water vapour into the stratosphere that's nearly 10% of the water already present there. This amount is enough to have a small, temporary warming effect on Earth's average temperature, they added.

265.title: Rainwater everywhere on Earth contains cancer-causing chemicals: Study
265.article_body: Rainwater, even in the remotest part of the Earth, contains cancer-causing forever chemicals making it unsafe to drink, a study has found. Forever chemicals are group of man-made hazardous products known as PFAS (polyfluoroalkyl substances) that have spread globally through water courses, oceans, soils and atmosphere. Hence, they can now be found even in rainwater and snow, researchers said.

266.title: High severity threats detected in iOS, iPadOS, ChromeOS, Firefox: CERT-In
266.article_body: Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) has found several highly severe vulnerabilities in iOS, iPadOS and macOS, along with Google's ChromeOS and Mozilla's Firefox browser. These vulnerabilities can be used to bypass security restrictions and cause denial-of-service attacks on users, rendering their devices unusable. These vulnerabilities can be fixed by installing software updates.

267.title: Will crack down on Islamic extremism if elected UK PM: Rishi Sunak
267.article_body: UK Prime Ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak on Wednesday said that he will crack down on Islamic extremism if voted to power, adding that he will bring necessary reforms to the country's anti-terror 'Prevent' programme. He also termed Islamic extremism as UK's "most significant terror threat". Sunak needs to win in the Conservative Party members' postal ballot to become the PM.

268.title: China must not help Russia: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
268.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Wednesday said China must not support Moscow in the Russia-Ukraine war and at least maintain its neutrality. “As for now, China is balancing and indeed has neutrality and...neutrality is better than China joining Russia,” Zelenskyy said. China has refused to criticise Russia's invasion of Ukraine but condemned US-led sanctions against Moscow.

269.title: Actor Dev Patel breaks up knife fight outside convenience store in Australia
269.article_body: Actor Dev Patel successfully stopped a street fight in Adelaide, Australia. Reports suggest that a man and a woman were having a knife fight outside a convenience store and the man was stabbed in the chest. The actor stepped in and stopped the fight. According to reports, the person stabbed in the chest is expected to survive.

270.title: Which 9 Indian companies feature on 2022 Fortune Global 500 list?
270.article_body: As many as nine Indian companies feature on 2022 Fortune Global 500 list. LIC is ranked 98th, while Reliance Industries is ranked 104th. Other Indian companies on the list are Indian Oil, Oil and Natural Gas, SBI, Bharat Petroleum, Tata Motors, Tata Steel and Rajesh Exports. The list ranks the world's largest corporations by revenue for fiscal 2021.

271.title: Which are the top 10 companies on 2022 Fortune Global 500 list?
271.article_body: Fortune on Wednesday announced the Fortune Global 500 list for 2022, ranking the world's largest corporations by revenue for fiscal 2021. Walmart has claimed the top spot for the ninth consecutive year. The top 10 includes four companies from the US, four from China and one each from Saudi Arabia and Germany.

272.title: MicroStrategy CEO Michael Saylor steps down after firm reports $900 mn in crypto losses
272.article_body: MicroStrategy Co-founder Michael Saylor has stepped down as the CEO of the company after the business-software company reported over $900 million in crypto losses. The company reported a second-quarter loss of around $1 billion. Saylor will move into the role of executive chairman, MicroStrategy said. MicroStrategy's president Phong Le will take on the additional role of CEO effective next week.

273.title: Amount involved in delayed payments to MSMEs doubled in 2 yrs: Govt
273.article_body: The amount involved in pending applications for delayed payment cases by MSMEs in FY22 nearly doubled from the FY20 amount, Union Minister BPS Verma said. Pending delayed payment applications involved ₹5,685 crore in FY22 to be paid by MSME buyers, up 97% from ₹2,887 crore stuck in FY20. The amount has to be paid by government departments, PSUs, etc.

274.title: Terror funding in J&K being done through Bitcoin trade from Pak: SIA
274.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Special Investigative Agency (SIA) on Wednesday carried out series of raids and found that terror financing in union territory is being done via Bitcoin trade, police said. "Details that are being investigated into...include a mastermind in Pakistan...who...has been pumping...money to...agents in J&K," police added. SIA also seized several phones and documents linked to suspects.

275.title: I am the father of expressway toll in India: Gadkari in Parliament
275.article_body: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Wednesday told Rajya Sabha members, "Fortunately or unfortunately, I'm the father of this toll because, for the first time in this country, I started the toll system." He said this after MPs expressed concerns over setting up of toll plazas on expressways inside city limits. Gadkari added that the issue will be rectified.

276.title: Mehbooba puts up new Twitter display picture with old J&K flag
276.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Wednesday uploaded a fresh display picture on Twitter, showing her late father Mufti Mohammad Sayeed and Prime Minister Narendra Modi with the Indian and old Jammu and Kashmir flags. "You... robbed us of our flag,” Mehbooba wrote. Modi earlier urged citizens to widely share the tricolour on social media ahead of Independence Day.

277.title: UP woman falls into deep gorge in U'khand while taking selfie; dies
277.article_body: A 28-year-old woman from Uttar Pradesh died after falling into a gorge while taking a selfie on the Rishikesh-Badrinath Highway, the State Disaster Response Force said on Wednesday. The deceased was returning from Kedarnath to Rishikesh in a car on Tuesday when she fell into the gorge near the Kaudiyala area, SDRF in-charge (Dhalwala) Kavindra Sajwan said.

278.title: No doubt Irani's family runs bar in Goa, she's a pathological liar: Cong
278.article_body: Congress spokesperson Girish Chodankar on Wednesday said there's no doubt that Union Minister Smriti Irani and her family runs Goa's Silly Souls Cafe and Bar, which allegedly had an illegal bar license. Eightall Food and Beverage, a company belonging to Irani's family, and the bar in question have the same GST number, Chodankar said. "She's a pathological liar," he added.

279.title: Babu Genu Chowk opened for traffic in Pune ahead of Ganesh Chaturthi
279.article_body: Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited has opened Pune's Babu Genu Chowk for traffic to avoid congestion during Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations. The route was closed due to metro work near Mahatma Phule Mandai. "As various stalls have been put up for the festive season, including Raksha Bandhan...we decided to open the stretch for public," the metro company's PRO Hemant Sonawane said.

280.title: Wealth management platform dezerv. raises $20 mn in Series A round
280.article_body: Wealth management startup, dezerv., has raised $20.7 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Accel Partners and saw participation from existing investors such as Elevation Capital, Matrix Partners, Whiteboard Capital, and GTM Ventures. The startup claims to have transacted assets of over ₹600 crore (as of June 2022) on its platform.

281.title: Fintech unicorn Yubi partners with U GRO Capital for MSME co-lending
281.article_body: Debt marketplace Yubi (formerly CredAvenue) has partnered with BSE-listed small business lending platform U GRO Capital. With the partnership, Yubi intends to integrate co-lending platform Yubi Co.Lend and supply chain finance platform Yubi FLow with U GRO's co-lending platform GRO Xstream and supply chain finance platform GRO-Line, respectively. Yubi said it has over 750 lenders on its platform.

282.title: Fintech startup Credit Fair raises $10 mn in seed extension round
282.article_body: Lending fintech startup, Credit Fair, has raised $10 million in debt and equity as part of its seed extension round. The round was led by LC Nueva Investment Partners and saw participation from venture capital fund Capital A and Sattva Family Office, among others. Founded in 2018, Mumbai-based Credit Fair has raised a total of $25 million, to date.

283.title: Income Tax Dept raids healthcare firms in Haryana and Delhi-NCR
283.article_body: The Income Tax Department has detected unaccounted income of over ₹150 crore, after it raided several business groups that run hospitals in Haryana and Delhi-NCR, the Central Board of Direct Taxes said on Wednesday. One of the groups was maintaining a parallel set of books of account, showing "systematic under-reporting" of receipts received from patients in cash, the Board said.

284.title: US Prez Biden to sign executive order to protect travel for abortion
284.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Wednesday will sign an executive order aimed at making it easier for women seeking abortions to travel between states to access the procedure. The order will seek healthcare providers to adhere to federal non-discrimination laws. This comes after US Supreme Court overturned the Roe vs Wade ruling, which made right to abortion a constitutional right.

285.title: Man released on bail rapes survivor again in MP's Jabalpur
285.article_body: A man, who was released on bail following his arrest in 2020 for raping a girl, allegedly raped her again with his two friends in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur. The accused had been reportedly threatening the 19-year-old girl with dire consequences if she didn't withdraw her complaint ever since he came out on bail. Police are looking for the accused.

286.title: Suryakumar Yadav becomes world number two T20I batter, only 2 rating points behind Babar
286.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav has become the world number two batter in the latest T20I rankings. The 31-year-old jumped three spots to be ranked second. He is just two rating points behind top-ranked Babar Azam. Suryakumar's 816 points are the third-highest rating points ever achieved by an Indian, behind Virat Kohli and KL Rahul.

287.title: Indian Army's Cheetah helicopter makes precautionary landing in UP
287.article_body: A Cheetah helicopter of the Indian Army made a precautionary landing near Prayagraj in Uttar Pradesh after the pilot saw the blinking of a warning light on Wednesday, Indian Army officials said. The helicopter took off again and landed at its base in Prayagraj after a check-up by a technician. The helicopter was carrying out a routine sortie.

288.title: Pune man who went missing 5 yrs ago was murdered by elder siblings: Police
288.article_body: A 23-year-old man, who was reported missing from Erandwane in Pune five years ago, was murdered allegedly by his two elder siblings with the help of an accomplice, police investigating the case said. The man's body was dumped in a canal near Hadapsar. As per his family members, he had left the house after an argument with them.

289.title: Man posing as gay on dating app attacks & robs techie in Bengaluru
289.article_body: Bengaluru Police arrested a man posing as gay and his two accomplices for allegedly robbing a software professional. The complainant claimed he got in touch with the accused on a dating application for gays and decided to meet him. When he arrived at the chosen place, the accused attacked him and robbed his laptop worth ₹1 lakh and other valuables.

290.title: Cluster bus kills 33-yr-old man, injures his brother in Delhi
290.article_body: A 33-year-old man died, while his brother was severely injured, allegedly after a cluster bus hit their scooter in Delhi's Dwarka Mor on Wednesday, police said. A case has been registered and an investigation is underway to arrest the driver, police said, adding CCTV cameras are being checked to establish the sequence of the accident.

291.title: Pune RTO starts drive against illegal bike taxis, seizes 35 vehicles
291.article_body: Pune Regional Transport Office has once again commenced a drive against illegally-running app-based auto rickshaws and two-wheeler bike taxis. Transport officer Ajit Shinde said RTO teams have seized 35 bike taxis till now. Shinde appealed to citizens not to use this service and said a police complaint will be lodged against bike taxi riders and companies running such services illegally.

292.title: B'luru Police bust inter-city drug racket; ₹2 cr contraband seized
292.article_body: Bengaluru Police busted an inter-city drug racket by arresting five alleged peddlers and seizing contraband, including cocaine, hashish, and ecstasy pills, worth over ₹2 crore from them. The accused would purchase the drugs on the darknet, making payments using cryptocurrency, police said. They recruited unemployed youths to sell the contraband in Delhi, Mumbai, and Bengaluru, officials said.

293.title: CA who got ₹30 lakh to open shell firms for loan scammers arrested in Delhi
293.article_body: Odisha Police have arrested a Chartered Accountant (CA) in Delhi's Paschim Vihar in connection with an online loan scam allegedly run by Chinese scammers. Accused Neerav Gupta, a resident of Gurugram, had received ₹30 lakh for opening and registering shell companies for use by the scammers to facilitate cash transactions. The scammers operated a digital loan application called Kredit Gold.

294.title: Drunk man sets himself ablaze outside police station in Thane, saved
294.article_body: Police on Wednesday said that a man claiming to be a 'terrorist' set himself ablaze outside a police station in Thane in an inebriated condition. The man, Niaz Ahmed Mainuddin Ansari, sustained 25% burn injuries and was saved by police personnel. A case was registered against him under IPC section 309 (attempt to commit suicide), police added.

295.title: Appreciate how Siddaramaiah ran K'taka govt: Rahul Gandhi
295.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi lauded Siddaramaiah on the latter's 75th birthday celebration and said he appreciates how Siddaramaiah ran the Karnataka government. "I don't usually attend birthday celebrations. I've come here because I share a special bond with Siddaramaiah...I share his compassion for the poor and weak," Rahul Gandhi said. "He gave direction to the people of Karnataka," he added.

296.title: UP woman throws acid mixed with chilli powder on husband for slapping her
296.article_body: A 27-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly reportedly poured acid mixed with chilli powder on her alcoholic husband while he was asleep for slapping her on Sunday. He suffered 40% burns and is undergoing treatment at a hospital. He reportedly took to alcohol after suffering losses at work during COVID and would often beat his wife and their four-year-old daughter.

297.title: 24-yr-old dies after touching overhead wire of local train in Mumbai
297.article_body: A 24-year-old man, travelling on the roof of a local train, succumbed to severe burn injuries on Tuesday after he touched the overhead wire. The deceased remained unidentified until Wednesday as the man's wallet and clothes were charred. The deceased's parents identified his body after looking at the birthmarks.

298.title: Free entry to all monuments from Aug 5-15 for 76th I-Day celebrations
298.article_body: Ahead of India's 76th Independence Day, the Union Culture Ministry on Wednesday announced free entry to all Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) protected monuments and sites across the country from August 5-15. The announcement comes as part of the government's 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' initiative. More than 3,500 monuments are protected by the ASI across India.

299.title: No caste discrimination in selection process in armed forces: Govt
299.article_body: Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai on Wednesday told Rajya Sabha that the selection process in armed forces is open to all citizens without any discrimination on the basis of caste. However, he noted that reservations are provided for people belonging to Scheduled Caste (SC), Scheduled Tribe (ST), Other Backward Class (OBC) and Economically Weaker Sections (EWS) categories.

300.title: Chembur residents complain of receiving worm-infested water
300.article_body: Residents of Utkarsh society in Chembur have been complaining of receiving worm-infested water since July. They claimed some people fell sick after consuming the contaminated water. "[BMC people] come and check the pipeline but are unable to find the source," they said. They've now taken to social media to share photos of muddy water to reach out to higher authorities.

301.title: Man thrashes health workers for vaccinating his daughter in Haryana
301.article_body: A man was nabbed on Wednesday for allegedly abusing and beating health workers for administering the COVID-19 vaccine dose to his daughter, who was brought to the immunisation centre by her mother, police said. The accused not only thrashed us but also threatened to kill us if we entered the village again, health worker Nirmal Yadav said in her complaint.

302.title: National Herald office sealed by ED a day after it conducted raids
302.article_body: Enforcement Directorate has sealed National Herald office, instructing the premises shouldn't be opened without prior permission. ED on Tuesday conducted searches at Herald House in connection with money laundering probe. Herald House is the registered office address of Associated Journals Limited, National Herald newspaper's publisher, which is under probe over its acquisition by Young Indian.

303.title: 3 killed, 6 others wounded in Chinese kindergarten stabbing
303.article_body: At least three people were killed and six others were left wounded in a knife attack on a kindergarten in China’s southeastern Jianxi province on Wednesday, police have said. The accused, identified as 48-year-old Liu Mouhui by police, is absconding after allegedly stabbing the victims. The ages of the victims have not yet been confirmed.

304.title: Fresh attempts aimed at finishing off Shiv Sena: Uddhav Thackeray
304.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday said that while attempts have been made in the past to cause a split in the party, fresh ones are being made to finish off Sena altogether. Thackeray had previously alleged that the search conducted by the ED at Sanjay Raut's residence was part of a "conspiracy" to finish off the party.

305.title: 5 arrested for running racket selling newborns in Hyderabad
305.article_body: Police busted a racket allegedly selling newborns in Hyderabad and arrested an IVF centre worker and four others. Police began investigating after ICDS supervisor of Devarakonda approached the police on July 28, alleging a couple had sold their newborn baby. Police found the couple had sold another baby last year after which they apprehended IVF centre worker and he confessed.

306.title: Delhi Airport express line to get 2-km extension, operational from Sept
306.article_body: The 2-km extension of Delhi Metro's Airport Express Line to the Dwarka sub-city will become operational from September. Train trial runs are being held on the stretch between the existing Sector 21 station and the new India International Convention Centre station in Sector 25. The effectiveness of signalling systems is tested during the trial runs, according to DMRC officials.

307.title: Realtor shot dead in Hyderabad, 3 arrested for murder within 24 hrs
307.article_body: Three persons were arrested in the murder case of a realtor who was shot dead in Hyderabad's Madhapur on Monday, police tweeted on Tuesday. The accused were identified as 50-year-old Mohammed Mujahed alias Mujju, 25-year-old Mohammed Jeelani Pasha and 31-year-old Mohammed Firoz Khan. Police recovered two country-made pistols, seven live cartridges, one knife, a car and a two-wheeler from them.

308.title: PIL filed in Delhi HC seeking ban on flying, manufacturing kites
308.article_body: A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) was filed in Delhi HC seeking Centre and Delhi government to impose a ban on manufacturing and flying kites. The petition stated that several persons and birds are killed due to accidents caused by kite strings. Last month, a man died after a kite string slit his throat while commuting on his bike in Delhi.

309.title: India defeat Canada 3-2, reach women's hockey semi-finals at CWG 2022
309.article_body: India defeated Canada 3-2 in their last Pool A match in women's hockey event at CWG 2022. With this, India qualified for the semi-finals. India are placed second in their group with three victories from four matches. India defeated Ghana, Wales and Canada in the group stage, while their only defeat came against England.

310.title: No history of contact between cases of monkeypox in Delhi: Report
310.article_body: There's no history of contact between the two Nigerian nationals who tested positive in Delhi for monkeypox and two other suspected cases, The Indian Express reported. All four have been living in different areas of Delhi and don't have any history of international travel either. However, all five monkeypox cases reported from Kerala had travelled to the UAE.

311.title: Uber to allow Delhi-NCR residents book ride via chatbot on WhatsApp
311.article_body: WhatsApp and Uber have announced their WhatsApp to Ride (WA2R) partnership for residents in Delhi-NCR. The feature will allow people to book a ride with Uber using WhatsApp chatbot. The service is available in both English and Hindi languages. In December 2021, the two companies successfully ran a pilot project in Lucknow.

312.title: Rupee not collapsing but finding its natural course: Sitharaman
312.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said that the Indian Rupee was not "collapsing" but finding its natural course. The Rupee has depreciated against the USD but its performance is still better than the currencies of other countries, she said. "We have withstood the impact of the US Fed's decisions much better than any other peer currencies," she added.

313.title: ₹3.35-cr assets of former B'luru corporator attached in DA case
313.article_body: Former Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike corporator G C Gowramma's assets worth ₹3.35 crore have been attached by the Enforcement Directorate in a disproportionate assets (DA) case. The attached properties include farm land, residential and commercial sites. The money laundering case was made after the Karnataka Lokayukta filed a chargesheet against the former Azad Nagar corporator.

314.title: Mumbai Police arrest 2 homeless men in state-wide bike theft racket
314.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested two homeless men, Babasaheb Kharat and Shankar Magre, for stealing motorcycles from Mumbai and selling them in Maharashtra's Aurangabad and Buldhana, officials said on Wednesday. Nine stolen motorcycles were recovered from them. Police said they were investigating a case where a motorcycle was stolen from a service road next to Western Express highway on July 2.

315.title: Guj HC grants bail to 'totally disabled' man accused of raping 8-yr-old girl
315.article_body: The Gujarat High Court on June 29 granted bail to a man accused of raping an eight-year-old girl on grounds of the man not being in a "fit state of mind" and suffering from "moderate mental retardation". The accused had allegedly inserted needles in the survivor's rectum and had threatened to kill the child if the child informed her parents.

316.title: Shiv Sena leader, friend booked for criminal intimidation & rape
316.article_body: Mumbai Police has registered an FIR against Shiv Sena's new Thane district chief Kedar Dighe and his friend Rohit Kapoor for alleged criminal intimidation and rape. Rohit allegedly raped the victim, following which Dighe called the victim and threatened her with dire consequences if she approached the authorities against Rohit, reports said.

317.title: Removed from power for publishing map including Kalapani: Ex-Nepal PM
317.article_body: Ex-Nepal PM KP Sharma Oli has claimed that he was removed from power after his government published a new map of the country that included Kalapani, Limpiyadhura and Lipulekh as its territories. Notably, India lays claim to these regions. Nepal's Supreme Court had ordered Sher Bahadur Deuba to replace Oli as the country's new PM last year.

318.title: Govt withdraws Personal Data Protection Bill, 2019
318.article_body: The government on Wednesday withdrew the Personal Data Protection Bill, 2019 from the Lok Sabha. The Bill, which was introduced on December 11, 2019, was intended to provide for a law for protection of personal data. Stating that a comprehensive legal framework is being worked upon, the government proposed to present a new bill.

319.title: 3 militants of Karbi United Liberation Army held in Assam, arms seized
319.article_body:
Three militants, including the self-styled chairman of the Karbi United Liberation Army, were arrested from Assam's Karbi Anglong district and arms and ammunition were recovered from them.
Police said that a member of the outfit was also injured in an encounter with police. District police launched the operation based on intelligence input, Pushpraj Singh, SP of Karbi Anglong district, said.

320.title: China suspends some trade with Taiwan 1 day after Pelosi's visit
320.article_body: China has suspended trade of selected goods with Taiwan one day after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to the island nation. China's General Administration of Customs said import of some fishes and fruits from Taiwan has been banned due to excessive pesticide residue detected "multiple times" on products since last year. Export of natural sand has also been suspended.

321.title: India register wins in sectional matches in men's singles, women's pairs in lawn bowls
321.article_body: Indian lawn bowls player Mridul Borgohain has won his second round in the men's singles at the ongoing CWG 2022. Meanwhile, Lovely Choubey and Nayanmoni Saikia have also registered a win in their second round in the women's pairs category. Mridul and the women's pairs team will have their next-round games later today.

322.title: PCMC to fine big societies for non-functional sewage treatment plants
322.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) will impose fines on big residential societies if the sewage treatment plants (STP) there are found to be non-functional. "We have already served notices to several housing societies to get their STPs in order. If they don't act in the next one month, we will cut off their drainage lines," a civic body official said.

323.title: 31-yr-old NGO operator, aide caught red-handed while selling newborn in H'yana
323.article_body: A 31-year-old NGO operator and her 34-year-old accomplice were caught red-handed while selling a one-month-old girl for ₹1 lakh in Haryana's Faridabad, police said. They used to take kids from poor families on promise of giving them a better upbringing and then sell them, according to police. The SI and ASI, posing as a childless couple, contacted the accused.

324.title: Vistara starts flight operations between Mumbai and Jeddah
324.article_body: Vistara has started flight operations on the Mumbai-Jeddah route three times a week with the inaugural flight taking off at 6.05 pm on Tuesday, the airline said. CEO Vinod Kannan said, "Given the multitude of upcoming futuristic projects in Saudi Arabia, strong trade ties with India and presence of large Indian diaspora, there is growing traffic between the two countries."

325.title: Over 34,000 women serving in CAPFs: Govt tells Rajya Sabha
325.article_body: Over 34,000 women are currently serving in Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs), government informed the Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. Of these, 9,454 women are serving in CRPF, followed by 7,391 in BSF and 9,320 in CISF, said MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai. He further informed that facilities like creches and daycare centres have also been provided to women employees.

326.title: India’s services sector growth hits 4-month low in July
326.article_body: The S&P Global India Services PMI Business Activity Index fell from 59.2 in June to 55.5 in July as inflation, unfavourable weather and competitive pressures restricted demand. The index pointed to the slowest growth rate in four months. Meanwhile, the growth in sales was driven by the domestic market even as international demand saw a decline.

327.title: Bengal CM Mamata reshuffles cabinet, Babul Supriyo, 8 more take oath as ministers
327.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee reshuffled her cabinet on Wednesday. Nine ministers including Babul Supriyo, Snehasis Chakraborty, Partha Bhowmick, Udayan Guha, Pradip Mazumdar, Tajmul Hossain, Satyajit Barman, Birbaha Hansda and Biplab Roy Chowdhury took oath in Kolkata today. Birbaha Hansda and Biplab Roy Chowdhury were sworn in as ministers with independent charges.

328.title: MI cricketer Kumar Kartikeya meets his family after 9 years and 3 months, shares pic
328.article_body: Mumbai Indians spinner Kumar Kartikeya met his family after nine years and three months. The 24-year-old took to Twitter to share a picture of himself with his mother and wrote, "Unable to express my feelings." Kartikeya, who made his MI debut in IPL 2022, had earlier said, "I'd decided to return home only when I achieve something in life."

329.title: US issues worldwide alert for its citizens after Al-Qaeda leader's killing
329.article_body: The US State Department has issued a worldwide alert to its citizens after the death of Al-Qaeda chief Ayman al-Zawahiri. "Following al-Zawahiri's death, supporters of [Al-Qaeda]...may seek to attack US facilities, personnel, or citizens," it said. "US citizens are strongly encouraged to maintain...vigilance and practice good situational awareness when travelling abroad," the caution read.

330.title: He plays high-risk shots better than everyone: Parthiv on Suryakumar's 76
330.article_body: Discussing batter Suryakumar Yadav's 76 off 44 balls in the third T20I against West Indies, ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said he executes high-risk shots better than everyone. "If a player can hit you over fine leg and also over long off and covers, then he's the most difficult batter to bowl to...That's the kind of batter Suryakumar is," he added.

331.title: I'd drop Shreyas, play Harshal in place of Avesh for 4th WI T20I: Parthiv
331.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has suggested Team India to drop Shreyas Iyer and include Ravindra Jadeja in the playing XI for the fourth T20I against West Indies. He also suggested playing Harshal Patel, if he's fit, in place of Avesh Khan. The 37-year-old further said that India should promote Deepak Hooda to bat at the number three position.

332.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank appoints Milind Nagnur as President and CTO
332.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank has announced the appointment of Milind Nagnur as President and Chief Technology Officer (CTO). Nagnur, who had been working at US-based Early Warning as CTO since June 2020, will be incharge of spearheading Kotak's technological transformation. Nagnur has previously worked with Wells Fargo Bank, JP Morgan Chase and Citigroup.

333.title: Only 342 liquor shops across 17 zones to operate in Delhi this month
333.article_body: A day after Delhi Lt Governor VK Saxena approved the extension of liquor licence by a month, six more zonal licensees exited the liquor business, leading to closure of 126 more shops. So, for August, there will be only 342 operational liquor shops located across 17 zones in the national capital. Until July 31, Delhi had 468 active liquor shops.

334.title: Assam MLA protests against decision to teach maths, science in English
334.article_body: Raijor Dal president Akhil Gogoi on Wednesday staged a sit-in protest in Assam's Guwahati against the state government's decision to teach maths and science in English in schools from Class 3 onwards. "The decisions to impart education in English in vernacular schools...not provincialising any schools in future are directly related to the future of the Assamese society," Gogoi said.

335.title: Congress no longer a party of Rajiv Gandhi, Indira Gandhi: Bishnoi
335.article_body: Haryana Congress MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi, after handing his resignation letter to state Assembly Speaker said he will work in BJP as an ordinary worker. "Congress is no longer the party of Rajiv Gandhi and Indira Gandhi," Bishnoi added. "We need to strengthen work done by CM Manohar Lal Khattar," he said earlier. Bishnoi is set to join BJP on Thursday.

336.title: Over 500 toilets meant for PwD can be used by transgenders: Delhi govt tells HC
336.article_body: The Delhi government has informed the Delhi High Court that 505 toilets meant for persons with disabilities (PwD) have been designated for the use of transgenders. Creation of separate toilets for use of transgenders will be done on a fast-track basis and  nine new toilets have already been constructed for their use, the Delhi government told the High Court.

337.title: Deeply apprehensive of implications: Opposition on SC's verdict on ED's powers
337.article_body: As many as 17 Opposition parties signed a joint statement over the Supreme Court's decision to uphold the Enforcement Directorate's powers under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, 2002. "We place on record our deep apprehension on the long-term implications of SC's judgement...without examining whether some of these amendments could have been enacted by way of Finance Act," they wrote.

338.title: All negativity around 'Laal...' has been curated by Aamir Khan: Kangana
338.article_body: Following a Twitter trend calling for the boycott of Aamir Khan's film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actress Kangana Ranaut reacted on Instagram saying, "All the negativity...[has been] skilfully curated by mastermind Aamir ji himself." "Even after Aamir...made Hinduphobic 'PK'...he gave...[his] biggest hits...please stop making it about religion...it takes away from their bad acting," added Kangana.

339.title: Why not start discussion on freebies with ending perks of MPs: Varun Gandhi
339.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Wednesday said there should be a discussion on pension and perks of MPs before questioning freebies given to the public. "Before pointing fingers at...relief given to the public, we should look within," Varun tweeted while referring to BJP leader Sushil Modi's notice in the Rajya Sabha demanding a discussion on "ending the culture of freebies".

340.title: Duo kidnaps 13-yr-old boy for ransom, kills him in Mumbai; arrested
340.article_body: Two men were arrested for allegedly kidnapping and killing a 13-year-old boy in Mumbai's Kashimira. The duo told the boy they would give him a phone and took him to a green patch at Waliv, where they stabbed him to death. They later demanded a ransom of ₹25 lakh from his mother, who earns by singing at restaurants and bars.

341.title: Executing agencies for 15 new bridges in Hyderabad finalised
341.article_body: The Telangana government finalised the executing agencies for the construction of 15 new bridges in Hyderabad across the Musi and Esa rivers. The construction would be divided between four agencies. The bridges would be made independently across the rivers for the development of surrounding areas and because existing bridges are unable to handle the increased traffic load.

342.title: Weightlifter Lovepreet Singh breaks his own national record, bags bronze at CWG 2022
342.article_body: India's 24-year-old weightlifter Lovepreet Singh lifted a total of 355 kg in the men's 109-kg final to bag a bronze medal at CWG 2022. He also broke his own national record. Lovepreet lifted 163 kg in snatch and 192 kg in clean and jerk. India have now won 14 medals at CWG 2022 so far, with nine coming from weightlifting.

343.title: US House Speaker Pelosi departs from Taiwan amid China tensions
343.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, who arrived in Taiwan on Tuesday, has departed from the country after meeting President Tsai Ing-wen earlier today. Pelosi, who pledged US' solidarity and cooperation with Taiwan during her visit, is the highest ranking US official to visit Taiwan in 25 years. Notably, her visit came amid warnings from China threatening consequences over the move.

344.title: Gati Shakti University will solve transport sector's complexities: Railways Min
344.article_body: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said that transport sector is complex and Gati Shakti University is needed to handle such complex system. "The university will focus on five areas including transport-based courses, skill development, applied research, technology development, and transport economics," he said in Parliament. On Monday, Gati Shakti University Bill was introduced in the Lok Sabha.

345.title: Pelosi's Taiwan trip an attempt to irritate China: Russia's Lavrov
345.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Lavrov said that US House Speaker Pelosi's visit to Taiwan is America's deliberate attempt to irritate China. Lavrov, who is on a visit to Myanmar, said that he can see no other reason to create such an annoyance almost out of the blue. China, that considers Taiwan a part of its own territory, condemned Pelosi's visit.

346.title: Former Amazon executive Pankaj Jathar becomes Etsy India's VP
346.article_body: Pankaj Jathar, former top executive of Amazon, has been appointed as Etsy India's Vice President and Country Head. In a statement, company said that Jathar will lead Etsy's India business to scale its marketplace capabilities further. He will also focus on using Etsy marketplace to connect sellers in creative community to millions of buyers around the world.

347.title: Don't understand how my name is on Brahmastra's Wikipedia page: Divyenndu
347.article_body: Actor Divyenndu said he doesn't understand how his name is on the Wikipedia page of 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva'. When asked about his experience of working with Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt in the film, Divyenndu said, "It's fake news...Maybe for a sequel. I don't deny but not for this one." The film is directed by Ayan Mukerji.

348.title: Locals pelt bricks at police as they arrest Jahangirpuri riots accused
