348.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday arrested a man wanted in the Jahangirpuri communal violence case. Police said Jahangirpuri locals tried to help the accused and pelted bricks at a head constable to prevent the arrest. The arrested man, 29-year-old Sanwar Malik, is accused of instigating violence during the Hanuman Jayanti celebration in April and pelting stones at people, including police officers.

349.title: Shiv Sena's Thane chief booked for threatening woman raped by friend
349.article_body: Shiv Sena's Thane district unit head, Kedar Dighe, has been booked for reportedly threatening a 23-year-old woman who was allegedly raped by his friend at a hotel in Lower Parel. "Dighe first told the woman not to go to the police and settle the matter by accepting money. When [she] didn't budge, Dighe allegedly threatened her for life," police said.

350.title: Former Andhra CM NTR's daughter cremated in Hyderabad
350.article_body: The last rites of K Uma Maheswari, the youngest daughter of former Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister NT Rama Rao, were performed in Hyderabad on Wednesday. The funeral was attended by her brother-in-law and former CM N Chandrababu Naidu, brother and actor N Balakrishna and other family members. Maheswari was found dead at her Jubilee Hills residence on Monday.

351.title: I'll inform my fans when time is right: Raj Anadkat on reports of quitting 'Taarak...'
351.article_body: Actor Raj Anadkat, who plays Tapu in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has reacted to the reports that suggest he is quitting the show. "My fans, my audience, my well-wishers, they all know that I am...good at creating suspense," he said. Raj added, "Whatever it is, I'll update my fans. When the time is right, everyone will get to know."

352.title: BMC invites tenders for upgradation of 400 km of roads in next 2 yrs
352.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has invited five tenders for upgradation and improvement of about 400 km of roads at an estimated cost of ₹5,800 crore. The road works are to be completed within 24 months and the liability period of the work will be 10 years. All these roads will be constructed with cement concrete.

353.title: Bodies of sisters aged 6 & 11 found holding hands after being killed in K'taka landslide
353.article_body: Two sisters, aged 6 and 11, who were found holding their hands were killed after they were trapped in their house following a landslide in Dakshina Kannada district of Karnataka. The bodies of the sisters were found after a lengthy search operation. Rescue personnel couldn't reach the spot immediately as a tree fell on the way and water was overflowing.

354.title: PM's message didn't reach his family: Congress to RSS on Tiranga campaign
354.article_body: Congress criticised RSS for not changing its display picture amid 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign and said, "We are putting DP of our leader Nehru with tricolour...But the Prime Minister's message does not seem to have reached his family." Sharing screenshots of profile pictures of RSS and its chief Mohan Bhagwat, Pawan Khera said, "Sangh people, at least now adopt tricolor."

355.title: MP Manoj Tiwari apologises for not wearing helmet during 'Tiranga bike rally'
355.article_body: BJP MP Manoj Tiwari took to his Twitter to apologise for not wearing a helmet during the 'Tiranga bike rally' held on Wednesday morning. He also said he would pay the challan for violating the traffic rule. He urged people not to drive two-wheelers without a helmet with a message that their friends and family need them.

356.title: Loudspeakers till 12 am for 5 days during Ganesh Utsav in Pune: CM Shinde
356.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde announced mandals will be permitted to play loudspeakers until midnight for five days instead of the usual four days during the Ganesh festival in Pune. Moreover, Shinde also asked the Pune Police to give five-year permission to the mandals to erect pandals through a one-window system. Currently, they apply for permission every year.

357.title: Suspended Cong MLAs part of conspiracy to topple J'khand govt: WB CID
357.article_body: West Bengal's Crime Investigation Department (CID) on Tuesday claimed that the three Jharkhand Congress MLAs arrested with ₹49 lakh were "part of a conspiracy to topple" the Jharkhand government, The Indian Express reported. CID strongly suspects "their indirect links with Assam CM through an influential person close to the BJP-led Centre". "We've found their links," a senior CID officer said.

358.title: Shares of Godrej Properties trade lower a day after Q1 results
358.article_body: A day after Godrej Properties declared its earnings for the quarter ended June, its shares were trading lower by over 3% intraday on the BSE on Wednesday. The real estate developer had reported a 154% year-on-year growth in consolidated profit at ₹43.3 crore and revenue surged 184%. Its Q1FY22 earnings were hit by the second wave of the COVID-19 pandemic.

359.title: Robinhood cuts 23% of staff, Co-Founder says 'this is on me'
359.article_body: Robinhood will fire 23% of its workforce three months after it announced to slash 9% of its full-time staff. In a blogpost, Robinhood's CEO and Co-founder Vlad Tenev took responsibility for the apparent over-hiring in 2021. "We are operating with more staffing than appropriate. This is on me," Tenev said. During April layoffs, the company was left with 3,100 employees.

360.title: 2 youths shoot Delhi jeweller in face, steal ₹25,000 from shop; held
360.article_body: Two youths shot a 46-year-old jeweller in face with a country-made pistol and made off with ₹25,000 from his silver jewellery shop in Delhi's Najafgarh area on Tuesday. Three hours later, the accused, who claimed to be 17 years old, were arrested during an encounter with Dwarka Police. The victim, Rajesh, is in a stable condition following a surgery.

361.title: MP man, out on bail, rapes same woman again after 2 yrs with friend; makes video
361.article_body: A man, who was released on bail in a 2020 rape case, allegedly raped the same woman at knife-point with his friend about a month back in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur, police said. The accused allegedly made a video, police added. The man threatened to make the video viral on social media if the previous complaint wasn't withdrawn, the victim claimed.

362.title: Deepak Deswal loses in men's 100-kg quarterfinals in judo at CWG 2022
362.article_body: Judoka Deepak Deswal, who defeated Cameroon's Eric Jean Sebastien in his round of 16 elimination bout earlier today, has lost to England's Harry Lovell-Hewitt in the men's 100-kg quarterfinals at the CWG 2022. India have won two medals, a silver and a bronze, in judo so far in the ongoing games. Judoka Shushila Devi had won silver in women's 48-kg.

363.title: Bikers snatch Bollywood director's phone in Delhi's Connaught Place
363.article_body: Two bike-borne men reportedly snatched a Bollywood director's mobile phone in the inner circle of Connaught Place in Delhi on Monday. Yogesh Ishwar Dhabuwala told police that the incident took place when he was standing at the edge of the street around 10:20 pm and was about to book a cab. "There's crucial information on my phone," Yogesh told police.

364.title: Principal booked for siphoning ₹11 cr from mid-day meal scheme: Police
364.article_body: A principal of Firozabad's primary school has been booked by Agra Police for allegedly siphoning ₹11.46 crore from the Mid-Day Meal (MDM) scheme. The teacher used fake documents to register a Non-Government Organisation (NGO) and siphoned funds with help of the officials and staff of his department and banks, Agra's Superintendent of Police (Vigilance) said.

365.title: No possibility of aligning with DMK in future: Tamil Nadu BJP chief
365.article_body: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai said there is no possibility that the saffron party will align with DMK as there is a stark contrast between their ideologies. "DMK senior leaders still talk about...separate Tamil Nadu. It's against...DNA of BJP," Annamalai added. His comments came after PM Modi inaugurated 44th International Chess Olympiad in presence of CM Stalin in Chennai.

366.title: Ro's Co-founder Rob Schutz to step down, assume advisory role
366.article_body: Rob Schutz, Ro's Co-founder and Chief Growth Officer, will step down from his position and will undertake an advisory role. The decision comes weeks after the digital health company laid off 18% of staff citing expense management and resource mapping. In an email to staff, Schutz said Ro has gotten to a scale where he can confidently pass the baton.

367.title: Defending a title is an even more special feeling: Paddler Sathiyan on CWG gold
367.article_body: Indian paddler Sathiyan Gnanasekaran has said that defending their 2018 CWG games gold in the men's table tennis team event at the ongoing CWG in Birmingham is "an even more special feeling". He added, "I have no words to describe this feeling...We'll now focus on individual events, it's a great start." Indian paddlers defeated Singapore 3-1 in the final.

368.title: Work for 2023 Karnataka polls unitedly: Rahul to state Congress unit
368.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday urged the party’s Karnataka unit to work unitedly for 2023 Assembly polls and not speak out publicly on leadership and internal matters. He attended state unit’s Political Affairs Committee meeting. "Entire leadership of Karnataka will join hands together and win...2023 polls…party leaders should not speak in different voices," Congress' KC Venugopal said.

369.title: Over 300 schools in Pune district have no access to drinking water
369.article_body: At least 333 schools in the Pune district lack access to drinking water facilities, data released by the state water supply and sanitation department showed on Tuesday. Additionally, 641 schools in Pune also don't have running water in toilets. Addressing this, Pune Zilla Parishad CEO Ayush Prasad said that the requisite facilities will be provided to these schools by mid-September.

370.title: Seems weird that Asia Cup is Kohli's audition but may well be that: Bhogle
370.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle said it sounds "very weird" that Asia Cup 2022 will be an audition for batter Virat Kohli, but added that it might well be that. "With Kohli, you are not looking at how many runs he has scored," he stated. Former India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said that Kohli might be seen opening in the Asia Cup.

371.title: Bounty raises $4.7 mn in seed round, aims to get brands onboard
371.article_body: Bounty has secured $4.7 million in seed round led by consumer tech venture capital firm M13. Bounty, an online platform that helps budding TikTok creators make money from their content, said that funding will be used to take brands onboard that are on waitlist. Bounty, that currently has 30 brands onboard, is tapping into brands' growing interest in small creators.

372.title: Haryana Congress MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi resigns, set to join BJP
372.article_body: Congress leader and Haryana MLA from Adampur constituency Kuldeep Bishnoi on Wednesday handed his resignation letter to the state Assembly Speaker. "We need to strengthen work done by CM Manohar Lal Khattar. We should give good message even to BJP that popular leader is joining the party," he said earlier. Bishnoi is set to join BJP on Thursday.

373.title: ED attaches 2 builders' assets worth ₹415 crore in 'India's biggest bank fraud'
373.article_body: Enforcement Directorate has attached assets worth ₹415 crore from builders Sanjay Chhabria and Avinash Bhosale, who were arrested in the Yes Bank-DHFL case that caused an alleged loss of ₹34,000 crore to a consortium of 17 banks. It is being called India's biggest bank fraud. The attached assets included land parcels and flats in Mumbai and high-end luxury cars.

374.title: Kansas voters block effort to ban abortions in state constitution
374.article_body: Voters in US state of Kansas on Tuesday rejected a constitutional amendment that would have declared that there is no right to abortion. Kansas is the first state to hold a referendum on abortion after US Supreme Court overturned Roe vs Wade in June, a ruling that granted abortion rights to women.

375.title: Pic of actress Pranitha sitting at husband's feet for ritual sparks debate, she responds
375.article_body: An image of actress Pranitha Subhash sitting at her husband's feet for a ritual has sparked a debate, with some social media users raising questions about patriarchy. "Just because I'm an actor...doesn't mean...I cannot follow a ritual that I...completely believe in," she responded. "One can be forward thinking and modern, but that doesn't mean one forgets one's roots," said Pranitha.

376.title: Did not take adult scenes from 'Forrest Gump' in 'Laal...': Aamir Khan
376.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has said a few changes have been made to 'Laal Singh Chaddha' from the original film 'Forrest Gump' to "suit the sensibilities of the Indian audiences". "The Hollywood film had a few adult scenes, we did not take those in our film," he added. Aamir said he wanted people to watch the film with their families.

377.title: FSSAI starts nationwide drive to check adulteration in edible oils
377.article_body: To check adulteration in edible oils and the presence of trans-fatty acids in hydrogenated oils, the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) has launched a nationwide campaign. The campaign, which will end on August 14, will also crack down on the sale of loose edible oil and multi-source edible oils without proper labelling across the country.

378.title: Got 1st film while asleep, wouldn't get films later even by running: Pankaj
378.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi said he got his first film while he was sleeping, adding he wouldn't get movies even by running after that. "Someone told them, 'An actor is sleeping over there, he has decent comic timing'...They...woke me up. I asked them, 'Who're you?'" added Pankaj. "I was like, 'What kind of a man is he?'" he stated.

379.title: Nintendo Switch sales fall 22% to 3.43 million units in Q1
379.article_body: Japan's Nintendo said on Wednesday that it sold 22% fewer Switch consoles in the quarter ended June compared with the corresponding period in the previous fiscal. The gaming company sold 3.43 million units of the console as against 4.45 million in the year-ago period. The company is forecasting a fall in the annual sale of the Switch devices this year.

380.title: Srikanth was so distraught, it was painful to watch him cry: Satwik on losing CWG final
380.article_body:
After India lost mixed badminton team final at CWG 2022, Satwiksairaj Rankireddy said, 
"[Kidambi] Srikanth anna was so distraught...But it's not just his mistake though he's blaming himself. Even I lost a match." He added, "It was painful to watch him cry." Srikanth lost his singles match in the final, while Satwiksairaj and Chirag Shetty lost the men's doubles match.

381.title: I was expecting bronze, had goosebumps while collecting silver medal: Vikas
381.article_body: Indian weightlifter Vikas Thakur, who won the silver medal in the men's 96-kg category at CWG 2022, has said he was expecting a bronze medal as the competition was "tough". He added, "I gave my best and won silver...Had goosebumps (while collecting the medal)...I dedicate the medal to my mother." Indian weightlifters have won eight medals so far.

382.title: No Oppn MP participated in 'Tiranga bike rally': BJP's Amit Malviya
382.article_body: No Opposition MP chose to participate in the 'Tiranga bike rally’ which was flagged off from the Red Fort on Wednesday, BJP leader Amit Malviya said. "Is this an unequivocal admission that BJP is the sole custodian of the Tiranga, a symbol of our national pride?" Malviya tweeted. The 'Tiranga bike rally' was organised today for MPs of all parties.

383.title: Sun Pharma Chairman Israel Makov to retire on August 29
383.article_body: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries on Wednesday said its Chairman Israel Makov will retire from the company on August 29. Makov has led the Mumbai-based pharma major for 10 years. "Makov has played a significant role in the company's global expansion...He guided the company into its next phase of growth with focus on innovation," Sun Pharma MD Dilip Shanghvi said.

384.title: It's all because of you: Chris Pratt on 8 yrs of 'Guardians of...'
384.article_body: Hollywood actor Chris Pratt took to Instagram after 'Guardians of the Galaxy' completed eight years of its release. The film had released on August 1, 2014, in the United States. "I'm constantly blown away by the community we've built in the past eight years! And it's all because of YOU," Chris wrote. The film was directed by James Gunn.

385.title: Pune Police arrest 4 for snatching gold chains during Palkhi processions
385.article_body: The crime branch of Pune Police arrested four men on Monday for snatching gold chains and robbing devotees during Palkhi processions in Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad. Police also recovered 24 tola gold ornaments worth ₹12,24,000 and two mobile phones worth ₹1,30,000 from the accused. According to police, the accused used to sell the stolen ornaments in Ahmednagar district.

386.title: Chandigarh Police arrests drunk man for brandishing 'weapon' while driving
386.article_body: A 23-year-old inebriated man was arrested by police for allegedly brandishing a "weapon", which was later found to be a dummy gun, while overspeeding near Chandigarh’s Nexus Elante Mall. On receiving information on Monday night, police stopped the man for checking when they found out that the weapon in the car was a dummy. After examination, he was found drunk.

387.title: Sri Lanka to restart IMF bailout talks in Aug: Prez Wickremesinghe
387.article_body: Sri Lanka's new President Ranil Wickremesinghe told Parliament on Wednesday that the country will restart bailout talks with International Monetary Fund (IMF) in August. He also called on lawmakers to form an all-party government to resolve a crippling economic crisis. Wickremesinghe took office last month after his predecessor Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country and quit following mass protests.

388.title: Rupee falls 27 paise to 78.80 against US dollar in early trade
388.article_body: The rupee fell 27 paise to 78.80 against the US dollar in opening trade on Wednesday. The rupee opened at 78.70 against the US dollar at the interbank foreign exchange, then declined to 78.80, registering a fall of 27 paise over the last close of 78.53 on Tuesday. Meanwhile, the dollar index fell by 0.07% to 106.16.

389.title: Traffic to be affected in Mumbai's Western Express Highway, Malabar Hill
389.article_body: Traffic movement is expected to be slow on Western Express Highway and Malabar Hill on Wednesday morning due to scheduled VVIP visit, the Mumbai Police said. "Traffic is likely to be slow between Santacruz Airport, WEH to Malabar Hill from 10:30 am to 11:30 am and Malabar Hill to Regal Circle from 12:30 pm to 06:00 pm," the police tweeted.

390.title: 'The Kashmir...', 'Bhool...' worked: Aamir on claims of B'wood films not working
390.article_body: Aamir Khan reacted to claims that Bollywood films are not doing well. "I don't see a shift. Historically, the films aren't good, people don't like them...People like films that are nice," he stated. Aamir added, "Now, people are liking Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa', Anupam Kher's 'The Kashmir Files' and Alia Bhatt's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' so it's working. Recently...'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' also worked...well."

391.title: 9-yr-old drowns in pit created by construction work in Gurugram
391.article_body: A nine-year-old boy allegedly drowned to death in Gurugram in a water-filled pit created by construction work on the Dwarka Expressway in Sector 109, police said. The incident took place when the victim went to bathe in the pit with a few friends on Monday evening. His friends got scared and fled from the spot after he drowned, police added.

392.title: Ruchira Kamboj takes charge as India's 1st woman UN envoy, says 'All girls can make it'
392.article_body: Ambassador Ruchira Kamboj on Tuesday took charge as India's first woman envoy to the UN in New York and presented her credentials to UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres. She tweeted, "A privilege to be the first Indian woman to be given the honour to hold this position. To the girls out there, we all can make it!"

393.title: Rahul changes profile pic to Nehru holding Tiranga amid BJP's campaign
393.article_body: Rahul Gandhi has changed his Twitter profile photo to India's first PM Jawaharlal Nehru holding national flag, a day after PM Narendra Modi asked Indians to put national flag as profile picture as part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "The tricolour is the country's pride. It is in the heart of every citizen," Rahul Gandhi tweeted.

394.title: Europe's largest nuclear plant in Ukraine out of control: UN nuclear chief
394.article_body: Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine "is completely out of control", UN nuclear watchdog International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) chief Rafael Grossi warned. "Every principle of nuclear safety has been violated" at the Zaporizhzhia plant, which Russian troops seized in March, Grossi said, urging Russia and Ukraine to allow experts to visit the complex to avoid a nuclear accident.

395.title: India under leadership of PM Modi has given us a breath of life: Sri Lanka President
395.article_body: Expressing gratitude towards PM Narendra Modi and people of India, newly elected Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Wednesday said, "Government of India under the leadership of PM Modi has given us a breath of life." "I wish to specially mention the assistance provided by India, our closest neighbour, in our efforts for economic revitalisation," Wickremesinghe added.

396.title: Daughter Palak Tiwari is too busy to meet me: Raja Chaudhary
396.article_body: Actor Raja Chaudhary, speaking about his daughter Palak Tiwari, has said that he does not get a chance to meet her. "I message or email her and wait for her reply...Maybe she is too busy or maybe she is ignoring me," he added. Palak is Raja's daughter from his marriage with ex-wife and actress Shweta Tiwari.

397.title: TRS MP Nageswara Rao's son robbed at knifepoint in Hyderabad, 2 arrested
397.article_body: The son of TRS MP N Nageswara Rao was robbed of ₹75,000 at knifepoint in Hyderabad, police said. The incident occurred on July 30 when two men on bike asked Rao's son Prithvi to stop his car and got into the vehicle. They then forced Prithvi to transfer money online, police said, adding that the two were later arrested.

398.title: People said 'shadi kab hui, bachha kab hua', to hell with that kind of thinking: Alia
398.article_body: Speaking on her pregnancy, Alia Bhatt said, "There were a few who said, 'Shadi kab hui, bachha kab hua'." Bhatt said, "Women are always questioned and are constantly battling things as if it's their fault." She added, "I'd like to say to hell with that kind of thinking. We're in 2022 and people should start living like they're in 2022."

399.title: Really pains me when women have to bear being beaten, depression: Alia
399.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said it "really pains" her when women have to bear ridiculous situations like being beaten or feeling depressed. "It pains me to see that...a lot of women still think there is no way out of a bad marriage," added Alia. "For women, like the one I play in 'Darlings', the idea of divorce is impossible," she stated.

400.title: I should be okay by the weekend: Rohit on retiring hurt in 3rd WI T20I
400.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma, who had retired hurt on 11 after suffering a back spasm while chasing WI's 165-run target in the third T20I, has said he should be "okay" by the weekend. Talking about the match, Rohit said, "We used the conditions and our variations really well...[our chase] was quite clinical." The fourth T20I will be played on Saturday.

401.title: 6-km jam on Pune-Bengaluru highway as thousands gather for Siddaramaiah's birthday
401.article_body: Karnataka's Davanagere district witnessed a six-kilometre-long traffic jam on the Pune-Bengaluru highway as thousands of people gathered for the 75th birthday celebrations of former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah. "I would like to appeal to those who come to Davanagere...to drive carefully and not in undue haste," Siddaramaiah tweeted. Notably, one person going to Davanagere died in a road accident.
